item.title: Ripple opens office in Luxembourg
item.description:
Ripple opens office in Luxembourg

Ripple announced Monday it has opened an office in Luxembourg. The launch is part of the distributed financial technology company's growing presence in Europe, following the opening of its London h...

item.title: Trace Mayer Predicts Bitcoin Price to Reach US$3,000 After Halving
item.description:
Trace Mayer Predicts Bitcoin Price to Reach US$3,000 After Halving

Trace Mayer, an Austrian economist and an investor in various Bitcoin startups including Bitpay, Armory, and Kraken, has stated in a recent interview that the price of bitcoin could very possibly reach US$3,000 after the bitcoin block reward halving takes place in mid-July.

item.title: Bitcoin Foundation Names South African Investor as New Director - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin Foundation Names South African Investor as New Director - CoinDesk

Bitcoin's oldest trade organization has voted in a new executive director. Weeks after outgoing executive director Bruce Fenton notified the board his term was nearing conclusion (rumors suggested he had resigned), the Bitcoin Foundation has named Llew Claasen to the position.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Tightening the Range - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Tightening the Range - NEWSBTC

Here's what we are looking at this evening in the bitcoin price. So the day has drawn to a close out of Europe, and it's time to put out the second of our twice daily bitcoin price watch analysis pieces.

item.title: The Man Who Claimed to Invent Bitcoin Now Wants a Patent Empire
item.description:
The Man Who Claimed to Invent Bitcoin Now Wants a Patent Empire

Craig Wright, the Australian who claimed to be the inventor of bitcoin, is attempting to build a large patent portfolio around the digital currency and technology underpinning it, according to associates of his and documents reviewed by Reuters.

item.title: DAO Soft Fork Revised to Allow Generic "Blacklisting" - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
DAO Soft Fork Revised to Allow Generic "Blacklisting" - Bitcoinist.net

The soft fork proposed to fix the sticky situation The DAO has dragged the Ethereum community into is here, and is a perhaps disproportionately drastic to the problem. The proposed solution to the DAO attack is to freeze all funds in the contract by blacklisting the hashes that correspond to the stored Ether.

item.title: Insurance Giant Allianz to Tame 'Cat' Swaps With Blockchain
item.description:
Insurance Giant Allianz to Tame 'Cat' Swaps With Blockchain

German-based insurance giant Allianz has announced it has been successfully testing Blockchain technology and smart contracts for the processing of default swaps and bonds. The company is feeling positive about the potential of technology to increase the competition among financial institutions.

item.title: Ledger Nano S Supports Both Bitcoin And Ethereum
item.description:
Ledger Nano S Supports Both Bitcoin And Ethereum

It appears as if Ledger one of the most popular Bitcoin hardware wallet manufacturers, have released a new model. The Ledger Nano S is a next generation hardware wallet, with open source software and support for multiple currencies. Pre-orders are open to residents all over the world, and shipping will start near the end of July 2016.

item.description:

The bitcoin price chart took a bearish turn earlier today and analysis looks at the most likely support levels where the bulls might be entrenched.
